articles.title: Apparent assassination attempt against vice president roils Argentina
articles.description: As Argentina's powerful Vice President Cristina Fernandez stepped from her car outside her apartment building and began shaking hands with a throng of a well-wishers, a man came forward with a gun, put it just inches from her face and pulled the trigger with a distinct click.
articles.content:
The Associated Press
BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) - As Argentina's powerful Vice President Cristina Fernandez stepped from her car outside her apartment building and began shaking hands with a throng of a well-wishers, a man came forward with a gun, ... [5755 chars]

articles.title: Argentina shaken by gun attack on VP Cristina Kirchner
articles.description: Argentines took to the streets of Buenos Aires on Friday in a show of solidarity against an apparent failed assassination attempt on powerful Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, which has shocked the South American country.
articles.content: Argentines took to the streets of Buenos Aires on Friday in a show of solidarity against an apparent failed assassination attempt on powerful Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, which has shocked the South American country. An assailant po... [3002 chars]

articles.title: Factbox: Recent attacks on prominent figures in Latin America
articles.description: Argentina's Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner on Thursday night survived an apparent assassination attempt after a gunman threatened her at near point-blank range and the gun failed to discharge.
articles.content:
A man wearing a pin depicting Argentine Vice President Cristina Fernandez stands outside her house after she was pointed at with a gun outside her home, in Buenos Aires, Argentina September 2, 2022. REUTERS/Agustin Marcarian

articles.title: Argentina-based yoga sect allegedly exploited women to lure wealthy men like Placido Domingo
articles.description: A sprawling investigation into the sect-like Buenos Aires Yoga School has uncovered what authorities are calling a criminal organization
articles.content:
Police escort Juan Percowicz to serve pre-trial detention at his home in Buenos Aires on Aug. 30.Natacha Pisarenko/The Associated Press
